sentences: Dominique-René de Lerma (born December 8, 1928) was an American musicologist and professor of music history, specializing in African-American music.
De Lerma taught at the Lawrence University Conservatory of Music, in Appleton, Wisconsin.
He published over 1000 works on music.
"A Musical and Sociological Review of Scott Joplin's "Treemonisha"".
African music: A pan-African annotated bibliography, p90.
The Continuum Encyclopedia of Popular Music of the World.
Columbia College Chicago : Dominique-Rene De Lerma papers
